DOC.brief_title: A Study Skin Systemic Biomarkers In Patients With Active Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus And In Healthy Volunteers
DOC.detailed_description: This Phase 0 multi-center longitudinal study biomarkers clinical parameter patient lupus erythematosus ( LE ) . Approximately 80 participant ( 20 healthy participant 60 patient LE ) enrol . This include 30 Discoid Lupus Erythematosus/Subacute Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus ( DLE/SCLE ) without Systemic Lupus Erythematosus ( SLE ) , 30 DLE/SCLE SLE . All patient LE continue manage personal physician per standard-of-care . Study participant undergo interventional procedure include collection urine , blood sample skin biopsy . There single sample collection timepoint healthy participant two sample collection timepoints LE patient , separate approximately 12 week . A blood sample genomic analysis collect research purpose patient provide consent local regulation permit . The data obtain study use evaluation new therapy lupus may help develop new treatment . Safety evaluation include assessment adverse event , clinical laboratory test , vital sign , physical examination . The total duration study participation approximately 11 day healthy participant 95 day patient LE .
DOC.criteria: Have Discoid Lupus Erythematosus ( DLE ) Subacute Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus ( SCLE ) without diagnosis Systemic Lupus Erythematosus ( SLE ) Active DLE active SCLE confirm histological analysis ( participant DLE SCLE without SLE ) Confirmed diagnosis SLE use American College Rheumatology criterion current historical positive antinuclear antibody ( ANA ) anti doublestranded deoxyribonucleic acid ( antidsDNA ) ( participant DLE SCLE SLE ) An active skin lesion biopsied ( participant lupus erythematosus ) Known think diagnosis druginduced lupus An active skin disease manifestation lupus erythematosus Has acute cutaneous lupus erythematosus rash If take antimalarial therapy stable dose least 8 week Day 1 Participants treat great 10mg/day prednisone therapy equivalent last 4 week prior Day 1 Positive serology human immunodeficiency virus antibody , hepatitis B virus , hepatitis C virus
